title: Fullscreen framerate issues
body: During my experience with league of legends my game has always worked until recently when the new client came out i started to get some issues with the game. When i downloaded my new client i saw a massive decline in frames when in full screen and my normal amount when in windowed, for a demonstration i normally get around 270-300 frames on uncapped but i cap my frame rate at 144 and i get all 144 on windowed (max settings) but when i switch to full screen i get around 30 on low-high graphics on uncapped frames. I uninstalled the game and reinstalled which made my League of Legends good for a whole game, but 4 hours later my frames were back to being utterly terrible. My specs are Nividia  970m with a i7-6700HQ 2.60 GHz so this low of frame rate is quite absurd. If anyone has a solution for my problem, please help as soon as possible.

replies.body:
We've historically seen these symptoms caused by the Windows Game Bar and the *Game DVR* feature inside this bar. I strongly recommend disabling the feature using [**this guide**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to ensure it isn't causing issues for you.

Please let me know if this helped.

I have already disabled the DVR and it has not made any changes to the frame rate, i believe the main problem is that the game is being run from my integrated graphics card and my computer is not allowing me to change it to my normal graphics card.

Running off integrated graphics could definitely cause issues. Have you set your windows power settings to [**high performance**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq6)? This usually fixes issues with League running off the wrong GPU.
